title: Meloni tightens security policy as political tensions grip Italy
subhed: The heavy atmosphere since the summer of 2025 has been exacerbated by footage of a police officer being violently assaulted by protesters in Turin at the end of January.
byline: By Allan Kaval (Turin, Italy, special correspondent)

title: Macron visits Dunkirk and champions a revival of the industrial sector
US commerce chief admits to Epstein Island lunch but denies closer ties
Moscow restricts Telegram as it pushes rival state-backed messaging app
subhed: From February 9, Russian users of the messaging and call app Telegram began reporting access issues. Russian authorities have denounced Telegram's alleged lack of action against its use for 'criminal and terrorist purposes.'

title: Gisèle Pelicot publishes memoirs after mass rape trial
subhed: In the nearly four-month trial that garnered global attention, her husband and 51 men were convicted. Gisèle Pelicot's courageous decision to lift the closed-door proceedings and her dignity during the hearing made her a leading figure in the fight against female violence. 'A Hymn to Life: Shame has to Change Sides' releases on February 17.

title: New York's 'bodega boys,' the Yemeni shopkeepers caught in Trump's immigration crackdown
subhed: The Trump administration imposed a new entry ban in June 2025 targeting 12 countries, including Yemen. The move has put at risk a community deeply rooted in the local economy: the 'bodega boys,' mostly Yemeni shopkeepers who run corner grocery stores throughout New York.

title: The international drug trafficker who operated right next to the Elysée Palace
subhed: Firat Cinko faces life imprisonment for allegedly orchestrating international cocaine trafficking between Venezuela, Martinique and France aboard a Smart car parked near the presidential palace in Paris.
byline: By Guillaume Daudin and  Abdelhak El Idrissi

title: Paris mayoral election: Searching for middle road, Bournazel rules out alliances
byline: By Hélène Bekmezian and Marie Pouzadoux

title: France's municipal elections at risk of foreign interference
subhed: Structurally less attractive to foreign spies than legislative elections, municipal elections are not immune to deception, most of which tends to be local.

title: Mayor and mother: The young women changing France's local councils
subhed: Only 41 women under the age of 30 were elected as mayors in 2020, out of France's 34,885 mayors. Here are the stories of several women who have balanced their careers, motherhood and first terms in office in a political scene often dominated by older men.

title: How Donald Trump is rewriting US history
subhed: As the country marks its 250th anniversary this year, the American president, who returned to the White House on January 20, 2025, has worked to shape a revised historical narrative, revealing signs of megalomania.

title: Jimmy Lai, a symbol of the end of freedom in Hong Kong
